rooms.name: Entrance Hall
rooms.description: A welcoming area with minimalistic design incorporating eco-friendly materials and floor-to-ceiling windows to ensure natural light, in accordance with Vastu principles.

rooms.name: Living Room
rooms.description: Spacious living area featuring large glass windows for maximum sunlight and energy efficiency. Eco-friendly materials such as bamboo or recycled wood are used, ensuring comfort and sustainability.

rooms.name: Dining Area
rooms.description: A compact yet functional dining space with natural lighting from floor-to-ceiling windows and minimalistic decor to maintain an eco-friendly ambience.

rooms.name: Guest Bedroom
rooms.description: Single bedroom designed for occasional use. Incorporates energy-efficient fixtures and ventilation, aligning with Vastu principles by positioning the bed away from the door.

rooms.name: Utility Room
rooms.description: Small utility space integrated into the design for storage of eco-friendly cleaning supplies and recycling purposes, designed for efficient use of space.

openings.description: Main entrance oriented towards the east as per Vastu norms, ensuring positive energy flow and maximizing natural light.
Floor-to-ceiling windows placed strategically for optimal daylight penetration while maintaining thermal comfort.

rooms.name: Master Bedroom
rooms.description: The primary bedroom with ample natural light from floor-to-ceiling windows and energy-efficient fixtures. Designed for relaxation, the room is oriented to capture calm energies in accordance with Vastu.

rooms.name: Second Bedroom
rooms.description: Additional bedroom incorporating eco-friendly design elements including non-toxic paints and sustainable insulation materials.

rooms.name: En-suite Bathroom
rooms.description: Bathroom designed with water conservation in mind using low-flow fixtures, natural ventilation strategies, and moisture-resistant eco-friendly finishes.

openings.description: A small balcony to provide personal outdoor space, featuring a green wall and solar panel integration for sustainable energy usage.
Eco-friendly staircase design using recycled materials that connects the ground floor to the first floor with minimal space consumption.
A compact, eco-friendly swimming pool designed with water-saving techniques and solar heating integration to reduce energy consumption.
A dedicated garden area fostering a large green space with native plants to promote biodiversity and natural cooling.
